## Explore the LSP data after new data updates

```{r setup, include=FALSE, message = F, warning = F}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, message = F, warning = F)

library(tidyverse)
library(here)
source('http://ohi-science.org/ohiprep_v2022/workflow/R/common.R')
region_data()
```

```{r}

lsp_scores <- read_csv(file.path(here(), "yearly_results/global2022/scores_2022-10-05.csv"))


lsp_status <- lsp_scores %>%
  filter(goal == "LSP", dimension == "status", region_id != 0) %>%
  left_join(rgns_eez, by = c("region_id" = "rgn_id"))
  

## get top ten and bottom ten scores for 2021

DT::datatable(lsp_status %>%
  filter(year == 2022) %>%
  arrange(-score) %>%
    dplyr::select(goal, dimension, rgn_name, year, score))


test <- lsp_status %>% filter(score ==100, year == 2022)



test <- lsp_status %>% filter(score ==100, year == 2012)

```


**Some interesting possible comparisons**

Within country, over time:
 - Pitcairn; 
    - implemented one of the biggest protected areas in world.
    - https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2015/mar/18/pitcairn-islands-marine-reserve-budget-2015
    
    
Pitcairn's score has increased dramatically over the past 10 years. Until 2015, Pitcairn did not have any protected areas in it's surrounding areas, and recieved a score 0. However, in 2015, the United Kingdom government implemeted the largest single marine reserve in the world (at the time), and it's score jumped to 100/100 in 2016, when the change was realized in the global OHI scores. 
    

```{r}
data <- lsp_status %>%
  filter(dimension == "status") %>%   # focus only on score data
  filter(region_id != 213)  %>% # eliminate Antarctica
  mutate(value = round(score, 0)) %>%
  mutate(rgn_name = as.character(rgn_name)) %>%
  group_by(region_id) %>% 
  mutate(meanIndex=mean(value[goal=="Index"])) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  data.frame() %>%
  filter(goal == "LSP")
  


data_pit <- data %>%
  filter(rgn_name == "Pitcairn")

data_pit


ggplot(data_pit, aes(y=rgn_name, x=year, fill=value)) + 
  geom_tile() +
  facet_grid(~goal) + 
  scale_fill_gradientn(colours=myPalette, na.value="black") +
  theme(axis.text.x  = element_text(angle=90, vjust=0.5), axis.text.y=element_text(size=10)) +
  ylab("") + 
  xlab("")
```

Seychelles: 

Seychelles had a LSP status score of 53.23 from 2012 to 2020, however, in 2021 the status score jumped to 100. Why did this occur? 
Seychelles completed its commitment to increase it’s marine protection to a full 30 percent of its exclusive economic zone (EEZ) in 2020. This major accomplishment is realized in the 2021 OHI LSP status score for Seychelles. It’s new marine protected area now covers an area larger than Germany. 
Source: https://www.nature.org/en-us/about-us/where-we-work/africa/stories-in-africa/seychelles-conservation-commitment-comes-to-life/

```{r}
data <- lsp_status %>%
  filter(dimension == "status") %>%   # focus only on score data
  filter(region_id != 213)  %>% # eliminate Antarctica
  mutate(value = round(score, 0)) %>%
  mutate(rgn_name = as.character(rgn_name)) %>%
  group_by(region_id) %>% 
  mutate(meanIndex=mean(value[goal=="Index"])) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  data.frame() %>%
  filter(goal == "LSP")
  


data_sey <- data %>%
  filter(rgn_name == "Seychelles")

data_sey


ggplot(data_sey, aes(y=rgn_name, x=year, fill=value)) +

```


Take the below stats from this folder: https://github.com/OHI-Science/ohiprep_v2022/tree/gh-pages/globalprep/lsp/v2022/int

Determine proportion of ocean/land areas that are protected

```{r}
prot_3nm <- read.csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OHI-Science/ohiprep_v2022/gh-pages/globalprep/lsp/v2022/int/area_protected_3nm.csv')

prot_3nm_2021 <- prot_3nm %>%
  filter(year == 2021) %>%
  mutate(type = "3nm")

sum(prot_3nm_2021$a_prot_km2) # 1103835
sum(prot_3nm_2021$a_tot_km2) # 4995189

1103835/4995189 # 0.2209796 ; ~22% of 3nm areas are protected 


prot_1km <- read.csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OHI-Science/ohiprep_v2022/gh-pages/globalprep/lsp/v2022/int/area_protected_1km.csv')

prot_1km_2021 <- prot_1km %>%
  filter(year == 2021) %>%
  mutate(type = "1km")

sum(prot_1km_2021$a_prot_km2) # 301274.8
sum(prot_1km_2021$a_tot_km2) # 1133638

301274.8/1133638 # 0.2657593 ; ~27% of 1km areas are protected 


prot_eez <- read.csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OHI-Science/ohiprep_v2022/gh-pages/globalprep/lsp/v2022/int/area_protected_eez.csv')

prot_eez_2021 <- prot_eez %>%
  filter(year == 2021) %>%
  mutate(type = "eez")

sum(prot_eez_2021$a_prot_km2) # 27816775
sum(prot_eez_2021$a_tot_km2) # 359482664

27816775/359482664 # 0.07738002 ; ~7.7% of eez areas are protected 


all_prot <- rbind(prot_eez_2021, prot_1km_2021, prot_3nm_2021) %>%
  group_by(type) %>%
  summarise(total_area = sum(a_tot_km2),
            total_prot_area = sum(a_prot_km2)) %>%
  mutate(percent_prot = (total_prot_area/total_area)*100)

all_prot
# A tibble: 3 × 4
#   type  total_area total_prot_area percent_prot
#   <chr>      <dbl>           <dbl>        <dbl>
# 1 1km     1133638.         301275.        26.6 
# 2 3nm     4995189         1103835.        22.1 
# 3 eez   359482664        27816775.         7.74
```
